search_parameters.q: How High School Organization Influences the Equitable Distribution of Learning in Mathematics and Science. Lee, Valerie E. Smith, Julia B. Croninger, Robert G. Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: How High School Organization Influences the Equitable Distribution of Learning in Mathematics and Science. Lee, Valerie E. Smith, Julia B. Croninger, Robert G. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: How high school organization influences the equitable distribution of learning in mathematics and science
organic_results.snippet: Using a sample of 9,631 students in 789 US high schools with three waves of data from the National Education Longitudinal Study of 1988, the study presented here was an extension of an earlier study that found positive effects for practices that are consistent with the restructuring movement on learning in the first two years of high school and on the equitable distribution of learning by social class. The current study identified the characteristics of high school organization that are positively related to learning in mathematics and science and to …
